metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8575 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The sco_sock_bind function in net/bluetooth/sco.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.3.4 does not verify an address length, which allows local users toobtain sensitive information from kernel memory and bypass the KASLRprotection mechanism via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
